item.title: AstraZeneca makes deal with White House to lower drug prices
item.description: The U.K.-based drugmaker became the second to strike a deal with the Trump administration as part of the president's push to rein in U.S. drug prices.

item.title: More than 20 kids in India have died from contaminated cough syrup. Who's to blame?
item.description: The cough syrup was contaminated with industrial chemicals. Experts say this is no accident. It's the latest case of what is being called a global cri...

item.title: 59% of Americans disapprove of RFK Jr.'s moves as health secretary, a new poll says
item.description: A new poll shows trust in federal health policies is plummeting, and what — or who — people believe increasingly depends on their politics.

item.title: This 4-year-old's heart is failing. A federal grant that might help him was canceled
item.description: A Cornell University researcher has been developing an artificial heart for children for more than 20 years. Now, his research is on hold and his lab ...

item.title: Former U.S. surgeons general call RFK Jr. a threat to the nation's health in op-ed
item.description: Six former U.S. surgeons general issued a warning about Health Secretary RFK Jr., calling him a "threat." NPR's A Martinez speaks with one of them, fo...
